intro: Platystele alucitae, commonly known as the Alucita platystele, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and produces delicate, white or pale green flowers. It is a rare and endangered species, often found in specific microhabitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
